abstract: Not only do college graduates earn significantly more than people whose highest educational attainment is a high school diploma, but that wage premium has been steadily increasing.
snippet: Not only do college graduates earn significantly more than people whose highest educational attainment is a high school diploma, but that wage premium has been steadily increasing.
lead_paragraph: We get a lot of questions (complaints, really) about whether college is worth the money, given how much it costs. If our previous reporting on the lower unemployment rates for college grads hasn't convinced you, maybe this chart from the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland will:
